title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0127

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Catherine.
And today we've got a great show for you.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你准备了一场精彩的节目。

segments.en: We're talking all about music.
It's a great topic.
I think everyone loves music.
segments.cn: 我想每个人都喜欢音乐。

segments.en: And, well, there's so much type of music out there, so that's what we're going to be talking about today.
segments.cn: 而且，音乐种类繁多，所以今天我们要讨论这个。

segments.en: Exactly.
So there's a little bit for everyone here.
segments.cn: 这里有适合每个人的内容。

segments.en: Even if you hate rock music, there might be something in it that you're going to be a fan of.
segments.cn: 即使你讨厌摇滚音乐，里面也可能有你会喜欢的东西。

segments.en: Right.
So before we get started on the dialogue, we have a couple of words that we want to preview, so let's take a look at them now in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 在我们开始对话之前，我们有几个词想要预览一下，所以现在让我们看看词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview.
Alright, so this word sounds a little bit funny.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个词听起来有点奇怪。

segments.en: It looks like it should be pronounced differently.
segments.cn: 看起来应该有不同的发音。

segments.en: We say genre.
Genre.
Or genre.
It kind of sounds French.
Is it French?
I think it comes from French.
It's a GE word, so genre.
It's a soft, soft sound.
And what's a genre?
Well, a genre is like a category.
So you could say genre of book or genre of music.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说书的genre或音乐的genre。

segments.en: Oh, movies also have genres, right?
Yeah, they do.
It's like horror movie is a genre.
Okay, or action or suspense, etc.
segments.cn: 好的，或者动作片或悬疑片等等。

segments.en: So we're going to be looking at music genres on this occasion.
segments.cn: 所以这次我们将关注音乐genre。

segments.en: And some of these genre names actually have abbreviations.
segments.cn: 这些genre名称实际上有些是缩写。

segments.en: They're long words that we say in short forms.
segments.cn: 它们是我们用简短形式表达的长词。

segments.en: And this kind of abbreviation is called an acronym.
segments.cn: 这种缩写叫做首字母缩略词。

segments.en: Alright, so that's another word that we're looking at.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们要关注的另一个词。

segments.en: Acronym.
So an acronym is a short version of a long word.
segments.cn: 所以首字母缩略词是长词的简短版本。

segments.en: Yeah, usually it's just letters.
Like USA is a very good acronym.
segments.cn: 比如USA是一个很好的首字母缩略词。

segments.en: It means United States of America.
Alright, cool.
So there are some acronyms as well in music, so that's what we're going to be looking at.
segments.cn: 所以音乐中也有一些首字母缩略词，这就是我们要关注的。

segments.en: And many other things.
I guess like DNA is an acronym.
segments.cn: 我想像DNA就是一个首字母缩略词。

segments.en: Yeah, DNA is an acronym.
segments.cn: 是的，DNA是一个首字母缩略词。

segments.en: UN is an acronym.
Alright, great.
So we're going to be looking at different genres of music.
segments.cn: 所以我们将关注不同的音乐genre。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 让我们第一次听听我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to listen to a game show where people have to name the song and the genre.
segments.cn: 我们将听一个游戏节目，参与者需要说出歌曲和genre。

segments.en: Welcome back music lovers to I Love That Song, the game show where we test your musical knowledge to the extreme.
segments.cn: 欢迎回来，音乐爱好者，来到《我爱这首歌》，这是一个测试你音乐知识的游戏节目。

segments.en: Let's get started.
Team A, guess this tune.
You're right.
100 points to Team A.
Now for our next cut.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的下一首曲子。

segments.en: I believe the genre is R&B.
100 big points for Team B.
For all of our viewers, the acronym R&B stands for rhythm and blues.
segments.cn: 对于所有观众，R&B的首字母缩略词代表节奏与蓝调。

segments.en: On that note, DJ, play our next song.
segments.cn: 说到这里，DJ，播放我们的下一首歌。

segments.en: Superstar by the Carpenters.
And the genre?
Um, um, adult contemporary?
That's right.
100 points.
Uh oh, that sound means it's double or nothing.
segments.cn: 哦哦，那声音意味着这是双倍或无。

segments.en: The songs are more difficult and the points are doubled.
Let's hear our next song.
Too easy.
That song is Kingslayer by the Finnish power metal group Nightwish.
segments.cn: 那首歌是芬兰力量金属乐队Nightwish的《Kingslayer》。

segments.en: You are correct.
Very impressive Team A.
And it seems we have a tie.
It's time now for the tiebreaker round.
Each team will be played three songs and they must tell us the genre of each song in less than five seconds.
segments.cn: 每队将播放三首歌，他们必须在五秒内告诉我们每首歌的genre。

segments.en: Team A, are you ready?
Ready.
Let's hear it.
Hip hop, classical and gothic metal.
You're right.
Team B, the pressure is on.
If you get all of them right, we will move on to sudden death.
segments.cn: 如果你们全部答对，我们将进入突然死亡。

segments.en: If you miss one, you lose.
segments.cn: 如果错一个，你们就输了。

segments.en: DJ, let's hear it.
Rap, disco and, and.
Fun show, Marco.
I kind of think I'd be good at this kind of game.
segments.cn: 我觉得我可能会在这种游戏中表现不错。

segments.en: I might win big.
Well, there were a lot of different types of genres in there and a lot of different music.
segments.cn: 好吧，里面有很多不同类型的genre和不同的音乐。

segments.en: I don't know, maybe not very popular, like, for example, country music.
segments.cn: 我不知道，也许不太受欢迎，比如乡村音乐。

segments.en: I don't know if many people outside of the United States actually know about this.
segments.cn: 我不知道美国以外有多少人知道这个。

segments.en: Well, there might be different kinds of country music, but, you know, in America, one of the most famous country music musicians is Garth Brooks.
segments.cn: 好吧，可能有不同种类的乡村音乐，但你知道，在美国，最著名的乡村音乐音乐家之一是Garth Brooks。

segments.en: And even if I didn't like his music, I grew up hearing it everywhere.
segments.cn: 即使我不喜欢他的音乐，我在各处都听到过。

segments.en: But you don't like it?
You know, it's one of those things that I like some kinds of country music, but it's a huge genre.
segments.cn: 你知道，我喜欢某些类型的乡村音乐，但这是一个庞大的genre。

segments.en: That means there's lots of different kinds of music within country.
segments.cn: 这意味着乡村音乐中有很多不同的音乐类型。

segments.en: All right.
Well, let's take a look at more of these genres now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们现在看看更多这些genre在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
All right, so we talked about country music.
segments.cn: 好的，我们谈到了乡村音乐。

segments.en: Now, this is mostly in the United States, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这主要是在美国，对吧？

segments.en: In the South especially, because there's a long tradition of country music in the Southern United States.
segments.cn: 尤其是在南方，因为南方美国有着悠久的乡村音乐传统。

segments.en: So it's very characteristic to have guitars and... A little bit of twang, maybe.
segments.cn: 所以有吉他和……可能有一点点的口音。

segments.en: Twang?
What is twang?
It's a way of saying a word.
So I could say, I'm from Texas, or I could say, I'm from Texas.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，我来自德克萨斯，或者我可以说，我来自德克萨斯。

segments.en: That's twang.
That's twang.
So kind of like an accent, a Southern accent.
segments.cn: 所以有点像口音，南方口音。

segments.en: Yeah, so Garth Brooks has a famous twang, I got friends and love.
segments.cn: 是的，Garth Brooks有着著名的口音，我有朋友和爱。

segments.en: You know, that's a very famous song of his where he's twangy.
segments.cn: 你知道，那是他非常著名的一首歌，他的口音很明显。

segments.en: Very Southern.
Yeah.
All right, so we have country music, and then we saw another genre, which is R&B.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有乡村音乐，然后我们看到另一个流派，就是R&B。

segments.en: Okay, this is a little bit more up my alley.
segments.cn: 好吧，这更符合我的兴趣。

segments.en: That means this is more of an interest of mine.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是我更感兴趣的。

segments.en: And R&B is an acronym for... Rhythm and Blues.
All right, so the R&B that we know now, what would be some examples of those artists?
segments.cn: 好的，那么我们现在知道的R&B，哪些艺术家是例子？

segments.en: Well, a really famous artist is John Legend, who's been touring the world with his new album, and that kind of music is R&B.
segments.cn: 嗯，一个非常著名的艺术家是John Legend，他正在世界各地巡演，发行了新专辑，这种音乐就是R&B。

segments.en: So we're talking about a kind of music that mixes jazz traditions with rhythm.
segments.cn: 所以我们谈论的是一种将爵士传统与节奏混合的音乐。

segments.en: So that means drums and bass.
Okay.
That's rhythm.
So you have rhythm and blues.
The song, like the name says, R&B.
Very popular nowadays.
Oh, and then we moved on to something heavier, something more like rock style, which is metal.
segments.cn: 哦，然后我们转向更重的东西，更像摇滚风格的金属。

segments.en: Metal.
Okay, I'm not really sure why they call it metal, but metal is a very, very popular kind of music.
segments.cn: 好吧，我不太确定为什么叫它金属，但金属是一种非常非常流行的音乐。

segments.en: So it divides into different categories, right?
segments.cn: 所以它分为不同的类别，对吧？

segments.en: In this song, we saw that it was power metal.
segments.cn: 在这首歌中，我们看到的是力量金属。

segments.en: Yeah.
But you also have like heavy metal.
Well, because metal is such a broad category, it's a big category, it's hard to say what certain groups are unless you're really a fan and you follow.
segments.cn: 嗯，因为金属是一个广泛的类别，很大，很难说某些乐队是什么，除非你真的是粉丝并且跟随。

segments.en: But there are many different kinds of metal out there, and so if you're interested, I would check it out on Wikipedia.
segments.cn: 但有很多不同类型的金属，如果你感兴趣，我建议你在维基百科上查一下。

segments.en: Yeah, or let us know if you know what's the difference between power metal and gothic metal and electronic metal.
segments.cn: 是的，或者告诉我们你知道力量金属、哥特金属和电子金属之间的区别。

segments.en: So there are so many different types now.
segments.cn: 现在有这么多不同的类型。

segments.en: But moving on to our next genre, we also saw something that everyone probably knows nowadays, and that's hip-hop.
segments.cn: 但接下来我们看到的流派，大家现在可能都知道，那就是嘻哈。

segments.en: Yeah, hip-hop is a great, great and very interesting kind of music.
segments.cn: 是的，嘻哈是一种很棒、非常有趣的音乐。

segments.en: It grew out of a lot of people who were listening to jazz in the late 80s, especially in New York, I think, Brooklyn.
segments.cn: 它起源于很多人在80年代末，尤其是在纽约，我想是布鲁克林，听爵士乐。

segments.en: And it's kind of interesting in the sense that you take these old records, these old vinyls, and you slow everything down.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，你把这些旧唱片，这些旧黑胶慢下来。

segments.en: Right.
So you change the speed.
So a normal song goes from dun dun dun dun to dun dun dun.
segments.cn: 所以一首正常的歌从 dun dun dun dun 变成 dun dun dun。

segments.en: And then you had like some bass in there.
Yeah, exactly.
And some lyrics, and you have yourself something like hip-hop.
segments.cn: 还有一些歌词，你就得到了嘻哈。

segments.en: So a very famous hip-hop artist nowadays would be 50 Cent.
segments.cn: 现在非常著名的嘻哈艺术家是50 Cent。

segments.en: Yeah.
Or for example, also Nelly, right?
Another famous hip-hop artist.
segments.cn: 另一个著名的嘻哈艺术家。

segments.en: Yeah.
So we have hip-hop, and it's kind of similar, I don't know, very similar to rap almost.
segments.cn: 所以我们有嘻哈，它有点类似，我不知道，几乎和说唱非常相似。

segments.en: Yeah, but it's different in that the way the process for making this kind of music is quite different.
segments.cn: 是的，但不同的是制作这种音乐的过程是相当不同的。

segments.en: Yeah, rap tends to be very lyric heavy, whereas hip-hop is very beat heavy, I think.
segments.cn: 是的，说唱往往歌词很重，而嘻哈则更注重节拍，我认为。

segments.en: Right.
So interesting, now we've seen a lot of these different genres, but of course there's so many more that we can't really look at all of them in one single podcast.
segments.cn: 所以很有趣，现在我们看到了很多不同的流派，但当然还有很多我们不能在一个播客中全部讨论。

segments.en: That's what our website's for.
segments.cn: 这就是我们网站的目的。

segments.en: You can put your favorite music genres up on our website and practice your English.
segments.cn: 你可以在我们的网站上发布你最喜欢的音乐流派，并练习你的英语。

segments.en: Exactly.
So, well why don't we listen to this dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么我们不再听一次这个对话呢？

segments.en: Let's slow it down just a little bit, and then we'll come back and look at some more phrases.
segments.cn: 让我们稍微放慢一点，然后我们再回来看看更多短语。

segments.en: Welcome back music lovers to I Love That Song, the game show where we test your musical knowledge to the extreme.
segments.cn: 欢迎回来，音乐爱好者们，欢迎来到我爱这首歌，这是一个测试你音乐知识的游戏节目。

segments.en: Let's get started.
Team A, guess this tune.
Uh, uh, Caring Your Love With Me by George Trait.
segments.cn: 嗯，嗯，George Trait的《Caring Your Love With Me》。

segments.en: The genre is country music.
You're right.
100 points to Team A.
Now for our next cut.
Thong Song by Cisco.
I believe the genre is country music.
segments.cn: 我相信这个流派是乡村音乐。

segments.en: The genre is R&B.
100 big points for Team B.
For all of our viewers, the acronym R&B stands for rhythm and blues.
segments.cn: 对于所有观众，R&B的缩写是节奏与蓝调。

segments.en: On that note, DJ, play our next song.
segments.cn: 在这个基础上，DJ，播放我们的下一首歌。

segments.en: Superstar by the Carpenters.
And the genre?
Um, um, adult contemporary?
That's right, 100 points.
Uh oh, that sound means it's double or nothing.
segments.cn: 哦哦，那声音意味着这是双倍或无。

segments.en: The songs are more difficult and the points are doubled.
Let's hear our next song.
Too Easy.
That song is Kingslayer by the Finnish power metal group Nightwish.
segments.cn: 那首歌是芬兰力量金属乐队Nightwish的《Kingslayer》。

segments.en: You are correct.
Very impressive, Team A.
And it seems we have a tie.
It's time now for the tiebreaker round.
Each team will be played three songs, and they must tell us the genre of each song in less than five seconds.
segments.cn: 每个队将播放三首歌，他们必须在五秒钟内告诉我们每首歌的流派。

segments.en: Team A, are you ready?
Ready.
Let's hear it.
Hip Hop, classical, and gothic metal.
You're right.
Team B, the pressure is on.
If you get all of them right, we will move on to Sudden Death.
segments.cn: 如果你们全部答对，我们将进入加时赛。

segments.en: If you miss one, you lose.
segments.cn: 如果错一个，你们就输了。

segments.en: DJ, let's hear it.
Rap, disco, and, and...
So it isn't a true EnglishPod lesson if we don't give you a couple of phrases and words to make you sound more fluent, so that's the purpose of this next portion of our show.
segments.cn: 如果我们不给你几个短语和单词让你听起来更流利，这就不是一个真正的EnglishPod课程，所以这是我们节目下一部分的目的。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.

Okay, so the phrases that we're going to look at now on Fluency Builder are the ones that we saw in the dialogue, but we can use, of course, outside of music or outside of a game show, and there was an interesting one that he mentioned when he said, double or nothing.
segments.cn: 好的，我们现在要看的短语是我们在对话中看到的，但当然可以在音乐或游戏节目之外使用，还有一个有趣的短语是他提到的，双倍或什么都没有。

segments.en: Double or nothing.
It's double or nothing.
segments.cn: 这是双倍或什么都没有。

segments.en: Well, this is an interesting phrase because it, I think, comes from gambling and betting.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的短语，因为我认为它源于赌博和下注。

segments.en: Yeah, so it's a way for us to say, well, you could double your money, but if you have a bad answer, if you lose this round, you don't get anything.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种说法，意思是你可以把钱翻倍，但如果你回答错误，如果你输掉这一轮，你就一无所有。

segments.en: Right.
So I guess, yeah, you do see a lot of people say, maybe they're betting or they're playing a game.
segments.cn: 所以我想，是的，你会看到很多人说，也许他们在下注或玩游戏。

segments.en: That person loses and says, okay, let's go double or nothing.
segments.cn: 那个人输了，说，好吧，让我们来个双倍或什么都没有。

segments.en: So give me one more shot to win back my money.
segments.cn: 所以给我一次机会赢回我的钱。

segments.en: Right.
So if I say, okay, Marco, you need to tell me the capital of Brazil.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说，好吧，Marco，你需要告诉我巴西的首都。

segments.en: You have $50.
If you get the answer right, you get $100.
segments.cn: 如果你答对了，你就得到100美元。

segments.en: But if you get the answer wrong, you get zero.
segments.cn: 但如果你答错了，你就得零。

segments.en: Right.
That's double or nothing.
segments.cn: 这就是双倍或什么都没有。

segments.en: Alright, interesting phrase.
What else do we have?
We've got a great one here called tiebreaker.
segments.cn: 我们有一个很好的短语叫做决胜局。

segments.en: So a tiebreaker.
Yeah, a tiebreaker.
It's a thing.
And sometimes in games, some people have the same score.
segments.cn: 有时在比赛中，有些人得分相同。

segments.en: They have the same amount of points.
So they're tied.
They're tied.
A tie means you have the same number.
segments.cn: 平局意味着你有相同的数字。

segments.en: And if you want to win, you need one winner.
segments.cn: 如果你想赢，你需要一个赢家。

segments.en: You have to have a tiebreaker to decide.
segments.cn: 你必须有一个决胜局来决定。

segments.en: So it could be a question or like we saw here, a tiebreaker round.
segments.cn: 所以可以是一个问题，或者像我们在这里看到的，决胜轮。

segments.en: Yeah.
So to decide on a winner.
And this is all or nothing because if you get the answer right, you win.
segments.cn: 这就是全有或全无，因为如果你答对了，你就赢了。

segments.en: If you don't, you lose.
It doesn't matter if you were tied before.
Right.
Alright, a tiebreaker.
And we have one more phrase.
And this one is really interesting.
The pressure is on.
So if I say, the pressure is on.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说，压力来了。

segments.en: It almost sounds painful.
Yeah, it does.
Does it mean that I am being pressured or what is this?
segments.cn: 这是否意味着我受到压力，还是怎么回事？

segments.en: Well, so it's a good question.
The important thing to look at here is the word on.
Because pressure has this kind of companion word to put pressure on something or to put pressure on someone.
segments.cn: 因为压力有一个伴随词，就是对某事施加压力或对某人施加压力。

segments.en: And so it's the way we say it in English.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们在英语中说的方式。

segments.en: And it means that you're going to really take things seriously from this point on.
segments.cn: 这意味着从这一点开始你会认真对待事情。

segments.en: Okay.
Right.
So for example, the Chicago Bulls were at the peak, the height of their fame, and they were just a wonderful team.
segments.cn: 例如，芝加哥公牛队在他们的巅峰时期，他们是一支出色的球队。

segments.en: And oftentimes you'd hear the announcers say, there's five seconds left on the clock.
segments.cn: 经常你会听到解说员说，时钟上还有五秒。

segments.en: The pressure is on Michael Jordan to win the game.
segments.cn: 压力在于迈克尔·乔丹赢得比赛。

segments.en: Alright, so the opportunity for the team to win all depended on Michael Jordan.
segments.cn: 好吧，球队获胜的机会全在于迈克尔·乔丹。

segments.en: Right, so the pressure, all of this stuff is on him, his shoulders, so he has to score the point to win the game.
segments.cn: 对，所以所有的压力都在他肩上，他必须得分才能赢得比赛。

segments.en: Okay.
This is a very interesting phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at some other examples of how we could use the pressure is on.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不看看其他一些例子，看看我们如何使用“压力来了”。

segments.en: Example one.
Carl is really stressed out lately.
The pressure of the entire project is on him since his promotion.
segments.cn: 自从他升职以来，整个项目的压力都在他身上。

segments.en: Example two.
The pressure is on the president to guide his country out of the recession.
segments.cn: 压力在于总统引导他的国家走出衰退。

segments.en: Example three.
The pressure is on our entire team to successfully come up with a new product for the Asian market within a month.
segments.cn: 我们整个团队的压力在于在一个月内成功推出一款新产品以进入亚洲市场。

segments.en: Alright, great examples, great phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，很好的例子，很好的短语。

segments.en: I think it's pretty clear now, right?
segments.cn: 我想现在很清楚了，对吧？

segments.en: It is, and to make sure that we understood the whole dialogue, I think we should take another listen to it at a normal speed.
segments.cn: 是的，为了确保我们理解整个对话，我认为我们应该再听一遍，速度正常。

segments.en: And when we come back, we'll be talking a little bit more about one of my favorite topics, music.
segments.cn: 当我们回来时，我们将谈论我最喜欢的话题之一，音乐。

segments.en: Welcome back music lovers to I Love That Song.
segments.cn: 欢迎回来，音乐爱好者，来到我爱这首歌。

segments.en: The game show where we test your musical knowledge to the extreme.
segments.cn: 这个游戏节目测试你的音乐知识到极限。

segments.en: Let's get started.
Team A, guess this tune.
Carrying Your Love With Me by George Strait.
segments.cn: 乔治·斯特雷特的《带着你的爱》。

segments.en: The genre is country music.
You're right.
100 points to Team A.
Now for our next cut.
Song sung by Cisco.
I believe the genre is R&B.
100 big points for Team B.
For all of our viewers, the acronym R&B stands for rhythm and blues.
segments.cn: 对于所有观众，R&B的缩写代表节奏与蓝调。

segments.en: On that note, DJ, play our next song.
segments.cn: 在这个基础上，DJ，播放我们的下一首歌。

segments.en: Superstar by the Carpenters.
segments.cn: 卡彭特乐队的《超级明星》。

segments.en: And the genre?
Um... adult contemporary?
That's right, 100 points.
Uh oh, that sound means it's double or nothing.
segments.cn: 哦哦，那声音意味着是双倍或什么都没有。

segments.en: The songs are more difficult and the points are doubled.
Let's hear our next song.
Too Easy!
That song is Kingslayer by the Finnish power metal group Nightwish.
segments.cn: 那首歌是芬兰力量金属乐队Nightwish的《杀王者》。

segments.en: You are correct.
Very impressive, Team A.
And it seems we have a tie.
It's time now for the tiebreaker round.
Each team will be played three songs and they must tell us the genre of each song in less than five seconds.
segments.cn: 每队将播放三首歌，他们必须在五秒内告诉我们每首歌的类型。

segments.en: Team A, are you ready?
Ready.
Let's hear it.
Hip-hop, classical, and gothic metal.
You're right.
Team B, the pressure is on.
If you get all of them right, we will move on to Sudden Death.
segments.cn: 如果你们全部答对，我们将进入加时赛。

segments.en: If you miss one, you lose.
segments.cn: 如果错一个，你们就输了。

segments.en: DJ, let's hear it.
Rap, disco, and... and...
Alright, so we have music, different music genres.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有音乐，不同的音乐类型。

segments.en: Which one are you mostly into?
As a hard question, I have very different interests.
segments.cn: 这是个难题，我的兴趣很广泛。

segments.en: I like classical music.
I also like jazz.
But I also like rock and I also like R&B.
I guess it depends on your mood, huh?
segments.cn: 我想这取决于你的心情，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
Now, they say that music does really influence people's moods.
segments.cn: 现在，他们说音乐确实会影响人们的情绪。

segments.en: They did a study.
Some doctors in America did a study to see if heart patients, people who have heart problems, could be positively affected by music.
segments.cn: 美国的一些医生做了一项研究，看看心脏病患者是否会受到音乐的积极影响。

segments.en: And the results said that yes, it can be helpful.
segments.cn: 结果显示，确实可以有帮助。

segments.en: Oh, really?
So maybe it helps them relax or... Yeah, it says if you're listening to the radio and a song that you like comes on the radio, you hear this song, your heart pumps more oxygen to your brain.
segments.cn: 所以也许它能帮助他们放松……是的，研究表明，如果你在听收音机，喜欢的歌曲播放时，你的心脏会向大脑输送更多氧气。

segments.en: So it means it actually makes you happier.
segments.cn: 这意味着它实际上让你更快乐。

segments.en: Wow.
What about when they play music for unborn babies?
segments.cn: 那么播放音乐给未出生的婴儿呢？

segments.en: Like they'll put little headphones on a mother's belly and they'll play like classical music?
segments.cn: 比如他们会在母亲的肚子上放小耳机，播放古典音乐？

segments.en: Because supposedly it'll make the baby smarter.
segments.cn: 因为据说这会让婴儿更聪明。

segments.en: Like baby Mozart or something?
Yeah, exactly.
What do you think about that?
I don't know.
I think talking to kids and giving them books when they're little probably helps a little bit more, but I'm not a doctor, so that I can't say.
segments.cn: 我认为和孩子们交谈，给他们书籍可能更有帮助，但我不是医生，所以不能确定。

segments.en: Well, many people do argue now that they don't make music like they used to.
segments.cn: 好吧，很多人现在争论说音乐没有以前那么好了。

segments.en: I guess they say that music that was made before, the lyrics were more profound, they were real musicians, they were composers, and they wrote lyrics, but now you just get a lot of temporary music that doesn't really transcend into the future.
segments.cn: 我想他们说以前的音乐歌词更深刻，是真正的音乐家，他们是作曲家，写歌词，但现在你得到的很多都是暂时的音乐，无法超越未来。

segments.en: What do you think?
I totally disagree.
I think the last ten years have seen a really amazing growth in the music industry because more people are communicating.
segments.cn: 我认为过去十年音乐产业经历了惊人的增长，因为更多的人在交流。

segments.en: The Internet allows us to hear all sorts of things from all over the world, and so we have great musicians who can listen to music from Mali, and they can listen to music from India, and they have all these different influences that were not there before.
segments.cn: 互联网让我们能听到来自世界各地的各种音乐，因此我们有伟大的音乐家可以听到来自马里的音乐，听到来自印度的音乐，他们有了以前没有的各种不同影响。

segments.en: And so I think it's the opposite.
segments.cn: 所以我认为情况正好相反。

segments.en: I think a lot of new pathways in music have opened up because of the technology evolution.
segments.cn: 我认为由于技术的进步，音乐中开辟了许多新的道路。

segments.en: Wow, interesting.
Well, what do you guys think?
Listeners, come to our website, englishpot.com, leave your questions and comments, and tell us what you think.
segments.cn: 听众们，来我们的网站englishpot.com，留下你们的问题和评论，告诉我们你们的想法。

segments.en: Do you think maybe music has become better in the last decade, or do you think maybe it's not so good?
segments.cn: 你认为音乐在过去十年中变得更好吗，还是觉得不太好？

segments.en: Well, you do have bad artists, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，你确实有糟糕的艺术家，对吧？

segments.en: You always have bad artists, yeah.
segments.cn: 你总是会有糟糕的艺术家，是的。

segments.en: The bad ones, they fade into history, you never hear from them again.
segments.cn: 糟糕的艺术家会消失在历史中，你再也听不到他们了。

segments.en: So come and let us know, and also, if you have any questions or doubts, you can leave them on this site as well.
segments.cn: 所以来告诉我们，如果你有任何问题或疑虑，也可以在这个网站上留言。

segments.en: Yeah, we're happy to answer any questions you've got, so let us know what you're thinking.
segments.cn: 是的，我们很乐意回答你们的问题，所以告诉我们你们的想法。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there, and until next time, bye everyone!
segments.cn: 好吧，我们下次见，大家再见！
